description:
The erection of a five storey building to the front
of the existing New Engineering Building and a part nine,
part ten storey building to the rear, for university
research  purposes (use Class D1),
as shown by drawing 1100-A, 1101-A, 1102-A, 100R-B, 100B-A,
1000-A, 1001-A, 1002-A, 1003-A, 1004-B, 1005-B, 1006-B,
1007-B, 1008-B, 1009-B, 2000-B, 2001-A, 2002-A, 2003-C,
2005-B, 3000-A, 3001-B, 3002-B, 3003-A3004-B, 3005-A, 3006,
3007, 3008, 4811C001;
- Design Statement dated 30.4.99;
- Design Statement in Relation to the Church of Christ the
King dated 14.9.99 .
- Diagrams 1 and 2 of the view from Greenwich to St.Pauls
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The building shall be used only for education use and for no
    other purpose, (including any other purpose within Class D1
    of the Schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use
    Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that
    Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting
    that order.

Condition : 2 - The disabled car parking space shown on drawing number 1000-
    A hereby permitted shall be provided before the development
    is occupied and shall thereafter be retained permanently for
    occupation by the vehicles of registered 'orange badge'
    holders, and for no other drivers or their vehicles.

Condition : 3 - The servicing area shown on drawing number 1000-A hereby
    permitted shall be provided and permanently maintained. All
    servicing of the site shall take place within the site and
    no goods or materials shall be accepted into the site except
    through the service yard thereby provided.

Condition : 4 - Before any part of the development thereby affected is
    begun, details of all external elevations, including
    samples, shall have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council. The development shall be completed in accordance
    with the details thereby permitted.

Condition : 5 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz inclusive, noise from all plant and machinery shall at all times add not more than one decibel to the ambient noise level expressed as L90  in the same octave band as measured 1 metre outside the window of any residential premises.

Condition : 7 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design
    method statement for all foundations and other development
    other than 2 metres below ground level, which takes account
    of the proposed running tunnels of the Chelsea Hackney Line
    Project, including any ground movement arising from the
    construction and operation of the said project has been
    submitted to and approved by London Underground Limited.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the future occupation of the building shall
    be in accordance with the Council's policy for the location
    of education uses in the University precinct as set out in
    policy CL4 of the London Borough of Camden's Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To ensure the permanent retention of the parking space for
    people with disabilities and to ensure that the use of the
    building does not add to traffic congestion in accordance
    with policy TR12 and the development standards for parking
    in the London Borough of Camden's Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 10 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with
    policy TR23 of the London Borough of Camden's Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - So that the Council and the Cross Rail Project Team may be
    satisfied that the proposed Crossrail Project is adequately
    safeguarded in accordance with the requirements of policy
    TR5 as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals
    of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939 (IH07)

Condition : 16 - The details required pursuant to additional condition 1
    should be submitted together with 6 sets of drawings and any
    other supporting information.

Condition : 17 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.
